game.name: Abra Ca Dabra
game.desc: With its mysterious magic and sorcery theme and unique layout, Abra Ca Dabra is one of the most beloved games released by Gottlieb in the mid-1970s. The game features a moving lit drop target that will score an indicated bonus value, a value which is increased by completing the rollover sequence or hitting the centre target after collecting all the drop targets....

game.name: AC_DC
game.desc: The first pinball machine produced by Stern in 2012, based on the musical career of hard rock / heavy metal band AC/DC.

game.name: Aliens Infestation
game.desc: A side-scrolling Metroidvania-style shooter based on the Alien movie franchise, developed by WayForward in collaboration with Gearbox.

game.name: Apollo 13
game.desc: A pinball game designed to capitalize on the release of the 1995 Tom Hanks film of the same name.

game.name: Attack of the Killer Tomatoes
game.desc: Play as Chad Finletter on a quest to make his way past evil mutant tomatoes and stop the crazy Dr. Putrid T. Gangreen from unleashing his Doomsday Tomato.

game.name: Aztec
game.desc: The player has to find the Golden Idol which is hidden within a ancient Aztec temple in this 2D action-adventure platformer.
game.publisher: Databyte, Datamost, Inc., Comptiq, Beyond - Challenging Software, Aackosoft International BV

game.name: Back to the Future
game.desc: The game features three songs, The Power of Love and Back in Time, by Huey Lewis and the News from the first movie and Doubleback, by ZZ Top from the third movie of the film series as well as Alan Silvestri's orchestral theme. Michael J. Fox refused to permit his image to be used to adorn the backglass of the game,so the replacement image of Marty McFly wearing glasses was port...

game.name: BattleToads
game.desc: A genre-defying tale of two toads' quest to rescue their kidnapped friends from the clenches of the Dark Queen. Where Frogger brought frogs to the forefront of videogaming, Battletoads taught children that toads weren't frogs and were here to kick some ass.
game.developer: Rare, Ltd., Arc System Works Co., Ltd.

game.name: Beetlejuice
game.desc: Play as the 'Ghost with the Most', Betelgeuse, in this LJN movie-licensed platformer.

game.name: Black Knight 2000
game.desc: Give me your money! The Black Knight rides again in this acclaimed sequel to Steve Ritchie's Black Knight.

game.name: Blackout
game.desc: Blackout was the first major release from Danish game developers Deadline Games. You play as a schizophrenic person with multiple personalities, who wakes up next to a headless corpse, and have no idea who or where you are, and from there on you have to remember.

game.name: Blue Max
game.desc: A pinball machine made in 1975 by Chicago Coin. It is essentially a 4-player version of Red Baron with different artwork.

game.name: Bram Stoker's Dracula
game.desc: A horror action platformer game based on the movie of the same name, released on a multitude of platforms from 1993 on, developed by Psygnosis, Traveller's Tales, and Probe Entertainment and published by Sony Imagesoft and Psygnosis.
game.developer: Traveller's Tales Ltd., Psygnosis Limited, Probe Entertainment

game.name: Captain Planet
game.desc: Captain Planet is the title character of the series. In the beginning of the series, Gaia assembles a modern-day team of "Planeteers" assembled from several nations. When the modern-day Planeteers combine their powers to summon the elemental warrior, this incarnation takes on the appearance of a superhero, who takes on the superhero-like name of "Captain Planet." Captain Planet...

game.name: Castlevania - Symphony of the Night
game.desc: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night is a 2D action-adventure platformer. Its open-ended gameplay mixed with RPG mechanics set the template for later Castlevania games, and its critical acclaim led to the coining of the term Metroidvania.
game.publisher: Konami Corporation, Digital Eclipse Software, Inc., Other Ocean Interactive, Konami Digital Entertainment, Inc., Sony Interactive Entertainment America
game.developer: Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo, Konami Computer Entertainment Nagoya Co., Ltd., Konami Digital Entertainment, Inc.

game.name: Contact
game.desc: Let The Professor guide you as you control Terry, an average boy who is unaware of your existence. You lead him in the search for cells to repair the Professors ship.
game.publisher: Rising Star Games, Marvelous, Atlus U.S.A., Inc.

game.name: Cyclone
game.desc: Another game by Costa Panayi that built on the engine used in Tornado Low Level.

game.name: DeathStar
game.desc: Deathstar (also stylised as DeathStar) is a multi-directional shoot-em-up released for the BBC Micro and Acorn Electron in 1984. It is a gameplay clone of Sinistar.

game.name: Die Hard
game.desc: A top-down action game originally released for the NES which put players in the shoes of John McClane, the action hero played by Bruce Willis from the popular film Die Hard.

game.name: Doctor Who
game.desc: Doctor Who is a 1992 pinball game by Bally, based on the classic BBC television show. The Master and Davros have teamed up to destroy Earth, and it's up to the Doctor and his six other counterparts to defeat them. Sylvester McCoy and Terry Molloy provide voice acting as the Seventh Doctor and Davros, respectively.

game.name: DUKE NUKEM FOREVER
game.desc: After approximately fourteen years of development, the heavily infamous sequel to Duke Nukem 3D was finally released, in which the macho Duke must damper yet another alien invasion.

game.name: Earthshaker
game.desc: Hold onto your Richter Scale: Earthshaker is a 1989 pinball game from Williams that literally shakes.

game.name: Elektra
game.desc: Totaly awesome hidden playfield on the last ball... One of my all time favorite pinball games from my childhood!

game.name: Flight 2000
game.desc: The game has 3-ball multiball where each ball is launched through three separate 'Lift-Off' stages. This is placed at the upper left of the playfield inside a maze-like ball lock mechanism. The playfield contains a ball capture feature in the upper left and a spinner and drop targets in the middle. Space ships heading to the stars are depicted on the backbox....

game.name: Funhouse
game.desc: Funhouse is a pinball machine that features Rudy, a talking head that lives on the table and mocks you as you play.

game.name: Gold Rush
game.desc: Gold Rush is an educational adventure game. The player picks one of three routes from Brooklyn to California in order to find their fortune in the gold rush of 1848.

game.name: Gorgar
game.desc: Gorgar is the first pinball table to exhibit synthesized voice, with a total of seven words.

game.name: Granada
game.desc: A top-down shooter, you play as the ultimate weapon Granada.The game was originally released on the Sharp X68000 in Japan in 1990. After it's admitted success, the game was ported to the Sega Genesis a year later.

game.name: Heist
game.desc: Move up through the floor of the tower. Dodge the guards and don't get caught. Heist is a difficult game that challenges the players memory, speed and skills.

game.name: Home Alone 2 - Lost in New York
game.path: /mnt/store/Emulation/Games/Future Pinball/Home Alone 2 - Lost in New York (Original 2013).fpt
game.desc: A video game adaptation loosely based on the 1992 movie Home Alone 2: Lost in New York. Kevin is accidentally flown to New York on his own and must avoid local perils as well as the persistent "Sticky Bandits" Harry and Marv.
game.developer: Manley & Associates, Inc., Interactive Designs, Imagineering Inc.

game.name: I Robot
game.desc: Ahead of its time; I, Robot was the first arcade game to feature filled 3D polygons.

game.name: Indiana Jones - The Pinball Adventure
game.desc: Indiana Jones: The Pinball Adventure is a pinball machine based on the Indiana Jones franchise.

game.name: Johnny Mnemonic
game.desc: FMV Action/Adventure game that follows the storyline of the 1995 cyberpunk thriller Johnny Mnemonic.

game.name: Jurassic Park
game.desc: Telltale Games continue on from the events of the first Jurassic Park film with this cinematic adventure game.

game.name: Knight Rider
game.desc: A driving/racing game for the NES very loosely based on the television show of the same name. It was developed by Japanese company Pack-in-Video and published in the west by Activision.
game.publisher: Acclaim Entertainment, Inc., Pack-In-Video Co., Ltd

game.name: Knock Out
game.desc: A Breakout clone written by John P. Shay and published by Solar Software for the Commodore 16.
game.publisher: Solar Software, Edizioni Fermont, Alternative Software Ltd.

game.name: Last Action Hero
game.desc: A brawler/action game based on the 1993 Arnold Schwarzenegger film of the same name.
game.developer: Dome Software Developments, The, Psygnosis Limited, Bits Studios Ltd., Teeny Weeny Games, Ltd.

game.name: Left 4 Dead
game.desc: Left 4 Dead puts players in the role of one of four survivors during a zombie apocalypse. Survivors will depend on co-operation to get from one safe house to another, while facing hordes of "Infected", four of which can be controlled by human players in certain game modes.
game.developer: Valve Corporation, Certain Affinity, Turtle Rock Studios, Inc.

game.name: Lethal Weapon 3
game.desc: Lethal Weapon 3 is a licensed pinball machine based on the movie of the same name.

game.name: Mad Max
game.desc: An open world action game with an emphasis on vehicular combat, based on the Mad Max character from the series of Australian post-apocalyptic films by George Miller.

game.name: Magician Lord
game.desc: One of the earliest games developed for the Neo Geo hardware, Magician Lord is a high-fantasy action platformer where players control a wizard that can transform into various warrior forms.
game.publisher: D4 Enterprise, Inc., Alpha Denshi Co., Ltd., SNK

game.name: Medieval Madness
game.desc: Released in 1997, Medieval Madness is one of the last games produced by Williams.

game.name: Monster Bash
game.desc: The main goal of the game is to collect the instruments of the iconic horror characters and form the Monsters of Rock band, The table includes a Phantom Flip. Players can let go of the flippers with this auto-play feature and watch the game complete the shots. The machine has an easter egg mode called “Lyman’s Lament”. It features different music and comments of programmer Lyman Sheats while the ball is played

game.name: Mystery Castle
game.desc: Mystery Castle is a retro styled fantasy puzzle game where players control Monty the Wizard.

game.name: OBLIVION
game.desc: A action game developed by Simon Morris and published by Alpha-Omega Software for ZX Spectrum.

game.name: OXO
game.desc: Designed in 1952 by Alexander S. Douglas for his PhD thesis, OXO is the world's first graphical computer game, created a decade before Spacewar! and six years before Tennis for Two.

game.name: Papers, Please
game.desc: A graphical adventure game about Cold War-era immigration control, where players take the role of an immigration inspector who must control the flow of people entering a fictional Soviet-style nation. Glory to Arstotzka!

game.name: Pharaoh
game.desc: Pharaoh is a Real-Time Strategy game by Sierra, where the player builds, governs and manages ancient Egyptian cities.

game.name: Pinball
game.desc: Originally released to Japanese markets in 1984, Pinball was later converted to the NES as a launch title in North America.

game.name: PinBot
game.desc: Pin*Bot is a pinball machine which has also been ported to the NES and Nintendo's PlayChoice-10 arcade system.
game.developer: Rare, Ltd., Williams Electronic Games, Inc.

game.name: Pink Panther
game.desc: A "collect 'em up" where the player must evade a character using cartoon tricks and abilities and collect various objects.

game.name: Pioneer
game.desc: Pioneer is a free, open source space exploration game, heavily inspired by David Braben's Elite games.

game.name: Pirates of the Caribbean
game.desc: Play as Nathaniel Hawk as you navigate the dangerous waters of the Caribbean. While the European nations vie for power, you can set out on your own, becoming a freelance corsair, peaceful merchant, or dastardly pirate. Just watch out for the skeleton monkeys.

game.name: Planet of the Apes
game.desc: A video game sequel to the original Planet of the Apes film starring Charlton Heston. Despite sharing the same cover as the game on PlayStation/PC, it is a completely different game with a different story and cast of characters.

game.name: Predator
game.desc: A side-scrolling action/shooter based on the 1987 Schwarzenegger movie Predator. It was published by Activision for many home computers, though its NES incarnation plays slightly differently.
game.developer: Activision, GlenHills Graphics Co., Pack-In-Video Co., Ltd

game.name: PROMETHEUS
game.desc: Prometheus is a mission-based, single-player co-op game in the spirit of “Portal” and “Mirror's Edge.” By using the Prometheus Device, players bend the laws of Einsteinian physics using the theory of quantum states, meaning that goals are accomplished by completing missions with your past, present and future selves. You'll need to keep your wits about you and your memor...

game.name: QBert's Quest
game.desc: The world famous orange pyramid hopper now has his own pinball game. It has a unique set of four flippers at the bottom.

game.name: Ripley's Believe It or Not
game.desc: Ripley's Believe It or Not! is a quiz game by Sierra specialising in unusual trivia.

game.name: Rollergames
game.desc: Go for The Wall with help from a magnet on this Steve Ritchie-designed table from Williams.

game.name: Sheriff
game.desc: 1979 arcade shooter by Nintendo where the player must fight sixteen surrounding desperadoes. A precursor to Donkey Kong, it was designed by Genyo Takeda, with assistance from Shigeru Miyamoto, working on his first video game. Possibly the first run & gun shooter, it also introduced the damsel-in-distress trope to gaming as well as continuous background music.
game.publisher: Nintendo, Exidy, Inc., Taito Corporation, Far East Video
game.genre: Action, Shooter, Dual-Joystick Shooter, Shoot 'Em Up

game.name: Sonic the Hedgehog
game.desc: The inaugural game in Sega's flagship series starring Sega's most iconic character the blue hedgehog known as Sonic. Sonic the Hedgehog infused conventional platforming with thrilling speed.

game.name: Space Cadet
game.desc: A previously unreleased game developed in 1984, Space Cadet later appeared in Game Room on the Xbox Live Arcade.

game.name: Space Invaders II
game.desc: A cocktail-style, US-only Space Invaders sequel (not to be confused with Space Invaders Part II, aka Deluxe Space Invaders in the states)

game.name: Spawn
game.desc: This portable game was the first appearance of the anti-hero Spawn in videogame form.

game.name: Spider-Man
game.desc: A side-scrolling action game based on the critically acclaimed '90s cartoon, Spider-Man: The Animated Series.

game.name: Spirit
game.desc: Take control of Spirit, in an intense retro inspired arcade experience. Guide Spirit against many different enemy types and distort space to force them into another dimension.

game.name: SpongeBob Squarepants
game.desc: SpongeBob SquarePants is a game for the Leapster based on the tv show of the same name

game.name: Star Trek
game.desc: Star Trek is a Stern pinball machine based on the 2009 Star Trek and the 2013 Star Trek: Into Darkness movies.

game.name: Star Wars - The Empire Strike Back
game.path: /mnt/store/Emulation/Games/Future Pinball/Star Wars - The Empire Strike Back (Hankin 1980).fpt
game.desc: The Empire Strikes Back for the Atari 2600 was the very first Star Wars game, released in May 1982. It recreates only one scene from the movie: the battle between snowspeeders and AT-AT walkers on the ice planet Hoth.

game.name: Superman
game.desc: The N64 Superman title is universally considered one of the worst videogames ever made, due to poor choices made in every aspect of its design.

game.name: SWORD GIRLS
game.desc: Sword Girls is a browser based card game featuring anime art style. While this is a card game, it's heavily dependent on a crafting system to keep its players occupied.

game.name: Tales from the Crypt
game.desc: Tales from the Crypt is a pinball machine based on the franchise of the same name.

game.name: The Addams Family
game.desc: A tie-in to the movie, players take control of Addams Family's lawyer, Tully Alford, as he ventures into the Addams Residence to find their family vault.

game.name: The Amazing Spiderman
game.desc: Announced at NYCC 2011, The Amazing Spider-Man game is an original story told after the 2012 movie. The console versions are developed by Beenox, the company that created Shattered Dimensions and Edge of Time while the DS version was developed by Other Ocean Studios.
game.developer: Beenox Studios, Other Ocean Interactive, Mercenary Technology

game.name: The Getaway - High Speed II
game.desc: Shift into high gear and burn rubber with this pinball machine by Steve Ritchie.

game.name: The King of Dragons
game.desc: A 1991 side-scrolling fantasy hack-and-slash brawler made by Capcom for Arcades. It contains a few RPG elements which would be better realized in Capcom's later Mystara games.

game.name: The Lord of the Rings
game.desc: The Lord of the Rings is a 2003 pinball game designed by George Gomez and distributed by Stern Pinball. It is based on the The Lord of the Rings (film series), which was first released in 2001. It features the highest possible score multiplier in pinball to date: During a combined "Two Towers" and "Gollum" Multiball it is possible to achieve a 84x Jackpot (when scoring seven su...

game.name: The New Zealand Story
game.desc: The New Zealand Story follows the exploits of a flightless native bird of New Zealand called a Kiwi, who happens to look very little like a real kiwi bird.
game.publisher: Taito Corporation, Erbe Software, S.A., Ocean Software Ltd., Imagine Software

game.name: The Simpsons Pinball Party
game.desc: The Simpsons Pinball Party by Stern is easily accessible (thanks to the recognizable Simpsons theme) for players of all skill levels and features some of the most innovative gizmos and gadgets as well as one of the hardest pinball challenges out there: "Super Duper Mega Extreme Wizard Mode"

game.name: The Walking Dead
game.desc: Starbreeze's Overkill is developing a new co-op focused game set in the Walking Dead universe.

game.name: THUNDERBIRDS
game.desc: Based on the movie by Jonathan Frakes, Alan Tracy, Tin-Tin, and Fermat take on dangerous missions using the most high-tech rescue vehicles on Earth: The Thunderbirds.

game.name: Titan
game.desc: A Breakout variant which allows for vertical movement around top-down environments. The goal is still to clear the stage of blocks by using the player's craft for angled shots.
game.publisher: Naxat Soft, Titus Interactive, S.A., Fujitsu

game.name: Tomb Raider
game.desc: A young and inexperienced Lara Croft is shipwrecked on a mysterious island in this reboot of the beloved action adventure franchise, which departs from the mood of prior games in the series.
game.developer: Crystal Dynamics, Inc., Eidos-Montréal, Nixxes Software BV, United Front Games, Square Visual Works

game.name: Tomb Raider - Underworld
game.desc: With an improved graphics engine, Lara Croft is back and is looking better than ever. This time around she'll be going on an adventure to find the sacred Mayan underworld of Xibalba in Southern Mexico.
game.developer: Crystal Dynamics, Inc., Nixxes Software BV

game.name: Transformers
game.desc: The ongoing war between the transforming robots continues! Featuring numerous appearances from iconic and playable Autobots and Decepticons, the game focuses on the franchise's continued struggle of Good vs. Evil in the first Transformers franchise game released on the PlayStation 2.
game.developer: Beam Software, Krome Studios Pty Ltd.

game.name: Twilight Zone
game.desc: Based off of the popular television series, Twilight Zone pinball is a complex pinball machine.

game.name: Ultimate Spider-Man
game.desc: Play as both Spider-Man and Venom in this cel-shaded open-world action-adventure game with story written by comic writer Brian Michael Bendis.

game.name: Vortex
game.desc: A single-screen shoot'em up written by Kevin Bagley and published by Datamost fr the Apple II computers.

game.name: Wall-E
game.desc: Based on the Pixar animated film taking place seven hundred years into the future, Wall-e is about the last functioning robot on Earth in this adventure platformer.
game.developer: Heavy Iron Studios, Asobo Studio, Helixe, Savage Entertainment, LLC, Pencil Test Studios

game.name: WANTED
game.desc: A Wild West light gun shoot 'em up from Sanritsu and Sega, released on the Sega Master System in late 1989.

game.name: Whirlwind
game.desc: Whirlwind is a 1990 pinball machine designed and manufactured by Williams Electronics. Themed around tornadoes, the machine is notable for three spinning discs on the playfield that spin the ball in random directions when activated during gameplay. Additionally, the machine had a fan located on the top of the backbox that blew in the player's face when the discs were active.

game.name: Wrath of Olympus
game.desc: A text adventure game, with the setting in ancient Greece, generated with the Incentive Graphic Adventure Creator and published by Alpha-Omega Software for the Amstrad CPC.

game.name: Xenon
game.desc: A shoot 'em up spanning four diverse levels. Players control a ship that can morph between a ground based tank and air attack ship.

game.name: Zombies Ate My Neighbors
game.desc: Play as Zeke or Julie through 55 deadly levels of Zombies Ate My Neighbors! Destroy zombies with a squirt gun full of holy water!
